title: Augusta County: John D. Imboden to John H. McCue, April 12, 1858
summary: John D. Imboden asks John H. McCue not to use a draft to pay a bill for the Lynchburg Hose and Fire Insurance Company when they are able to wait for the money. Imboden also writes, at length, of upcoming local elections.
keywords: Economy, Family, State Government, Women, American Civil War
